intro: Dichrostachys lugardiae, commonly known as the African burr bush, is a shrub or small tree native to Africa. It belongs to the Leguminosae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and distinctive, woody, spiny pods. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species in regions with low rainfall. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its seeds are dispersed by animals, contributing to its spread across various habitats.
